result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy Lee Moore Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees to be taken out of bail on deposit, if any, with the balance due on or before 10-15-2016.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 10 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, if all ready employed; and medical treatment, including surgeries.  Possession or use of any illegal controlled substances or alcohol forfeits the Huber privileges.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Defendant required to provide DNA to the State Crime Lab for testing.

As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or body armor at any time in the future - 941.29 Wis. Stats makes it another felony for anyone who has bee convicted of a felony to ever possess a firearm, carrying with it its own 10 year period imprisonment or $25,000 fine or both. Possess Weapon as Convicted Felon - 973.176(1). You may not possess body armor at any time in the future - 941.291 Wis. Stats make it another felony for anyone who has been convicted of this felony to ever possess body armor, carrying with it its own 15 year period of imprisonment or $50,000 fine or both. Possess Body Armor - 973.0335.  Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy Lee Moore Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Randy Lee Moore in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 10 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, if all ready employed; and medical treatment, including surgeries.  Possession or use of any illegal controlled substances or alcohol forfeits the Huber privileges. 

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS:
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees to be taken out of bail on deposit, if any, with the balance due on or before 10-15-2016.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  Defendant required to provide DNA to the State Crime Lab for testing.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or body armor at any time in the future - 941.29 Wis. Stats makes it another felony for anyone who has bee convicted of a felony to ever possess a firearm, carrying with it its own 10 year period imprisonment or $25,000 fine or both. Possess Weapon as Convicted Felon - 973.176(1). You may not possess body armor at any time in the future - 941.291 Wis. Stats make it another felony for anyone who has been convicted of this felony to ever possess body armor, carrying with it its own 15 year period of imprisonment or $50,000 fine or both. Possess Body Armor - 973.0335.  Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
*  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Violation report - 10-7-15 - missed telephone contact received and filed./ds

Defendant Randy Lee Moore in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Restitution will be addressed at that time.  Because of the possibility of incarceration, the defendant should be prepared to start serving the sentence on the next date. 

Defendant may be having surgery due to a prior gunshot wound.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Court reminds defendant to not possess or use any controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
